parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the transfer case can cause vibration, shuddering, or loss of power while driving, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: smoke or steam coming from the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the driveshaft can cause loss of power, vibration, or unusual noises while driving, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
Glycol leakage from the EGR valve can cause smoldering particles, leading to the melting of the intake manifold and, in rare cases, a fire.
symptoms: but potential symptoms may include engine performance issues

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine seizure can cause sudden loss of power, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
NOx sensor failure can cause issues with emissions control, leading to decreased engine performance and potential environmental harm.
Cooling system failure can cause engine overheating, leading to engine damage or seizure.
Turbocharger failure can cause engine performance issues, leading to decreased power and potential engine damage.
The failure of the power steering system can cause loss of control, making it difficult or impossible to steer the vehicle, which can lead to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: pulling to one side while braking
sudden acceleration without braking or steering.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the idler pulley bolt can cause loss of power steering, making it difficult or impossible to steer the vehicle, which can lead to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
The failure of the steering rack can cause loss of control, making it difficult or impossible to steer the vehicle, which can lead to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: Excessive play inside the steering rack
pulling to one side while braking
